title: Spiralized Winter Vegetable Gratin
directions: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Grease a 9-by-13-inch casserole dish with nonstick spray.
Add the parsnip noodles, sweet potato noodles, butternut squash noodles and olive oil to the casserole dish; season with salt and pepper and toss to combine.
Roast until the vegetables start to become tender, 30 to 35 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a medium saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the onion and sauté until translucent, about 4 minutes. Add the garlic and sauté until fragrant, about 1 minute.

Stir the flour into the saucepan until combined, about 1 minute. Add the whole milk and bring the mixture to a simmer, stirring constantly. Stir in the Parmesan and ¾ cup of the Gruyère; season with salt and pepper.
Remove the casserole dish from the oven and pour the sauce over the vegetables. Toss gently to combine.
Sprinkle the remaining ½ cup Gruyère over the surface of the gratin, and return to the oven until the vegetables are very tender and the cheese is melted and golden brown, 12 to 15 minutes.
Garnish with thyme, rosemary and parsley. Serve immediately.
ingredients: 3 large parsnips, peeled and cut into noodles with a spiralizer
2 medium sweet potatoes, peeled and cut into noodles with a spiralizer
1 small butternut squash, peeled and cut into noodles with a spiralizer
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
